root.pub-comments: "The author has concluded that Miao-Yao and Kadai are genetically related on the basis of the phonological correspondences between them […] The whole of this newly-hypothesized linguistic family, that connects Miao-Yao and Kadai, is temporarily designated as "Miao-Dai" family in this preliminary study" (Kosaka 2002:96-97).

child.pub-comments: Author indicates that Proto-Kadai also underwent considerable influence by contact from Chinese (Kosaka 2002:97).
child.publications: Kosaka, Ryuichi. 2002. On the affiliation of Miao-Yao and Kadai: Can we posit the Miao-Dai family?, Mon-Khmer Studies, vol. 32, 71-100. Research Institute for Language and Culture of Asia: SIL International. ISBN 0147-5207

child.pub-comments: "As for the genetic relation of Miao-Yao/Kadai to Austronesian, that was proposed by Benedict (1942), it is true that the resemblance found in some highly basic vocabulary items seems hardly coincidental. On account of the paucity of examples allowing us to elicit sets of systematic correspondences, however, we cannot help but abandon, for the time being, the idea of affording any decisive judgment as to the genuine nature of the relationship between Miao-Yao/Kadai and Austronesian" (Kosaka 2002:97).
child.publications: Kosaka, Ryuichi. 2002. On the affiliation of Miao-Yao and Kadai: Can we posit the Miao-Dai family?, Mon-Khmer Studies, vol. 32, 71-100. Research Institute for Language and Culture of Asia: SIL International. ISBN 0147-5207

child.pub-comments: Author indicates that although Proto-Miao-Yao is genetically descended from Proto-Miao-Dai, it has been greatly influenced by contact from Chinese, Tibeto-Burman, and Mon-Khmer (Kosaka 2002:97).
child.publications: Kosaka, Ryuichi. 2002. On the affiliation of Miao-Yao and Kadai: Can we posit the Miao-Dai family?, Mon-Khmer Studies, vol. 32, 71-100. Research Institute for Language and Culture of Asia: SIL International. ISBN 0147-5207

root.publications: Kosaka, Ryuichi. 2002. On the affiliation of Miao-Yao and Kadai: Can we posit the Miao-Dai family?, Mon-Khmer Studies, vol. 32, 71-100. Research Institute for Language and Culture of Asia: SIL International. ISBN 0147-5207
